text: P.S. If anyone else is interested but have not tried streaming yet, please say what you would be interested in hearing streamers discuss (e.g. things like, "how do I get started?", "how do I foster a welcoming community?", "What should I stream on?", etc.)! Thanks!

elements.text: P.S. If anyone else is interested but have not tried streaming yet, please say what you would be interested in hearing streamers discuss (e.g. things like, "how do I get started?", "how do I foster a welcoming community?", "What should I stream on?", etc.)! Thanks!

text:
I would be interested in learning more in general. I'm interested in online content creation and I think videos and live-streaming (to do structured lesson-type content) might interesting to try one day.

Maybe some things to add in the proposal:
• How do you attract and sustain an audience?
• Any things to consider on equipment for streaming?
• How important is it to consisently stream?
• What are examples of great interactions from the community to aim towards (e.g. collaborations between audience and streamer/content creator)?
• What are some interesting potential collaborations within the greater Julia community that might serve as an opportunity for content creation (e.g. interviews, or discussing pieces of code amongst people, or clarifying a Julia package to help bring more new contributors in, etc.)
• What are some best practices when streaming/content-creation?
Since this is a BoF event, maybe if there's any non-content-creators popping in, then maybe:
• What sort of content would you be interested in seeing?
Not sure just trying to give ideas to help with the proposal!
